awd_titl_txt: Near-Source Ground-Motion Behavoir of the June 20, 1990     Earthquake
awd_abstract_narration: This grant will fund urgently needed support through the SGER                 program to analyze the June 20, 1990, earthquake in northern                    Iran.  The principal investigator has obtained a unique data set                of 33 measurements of peak ground acceleration recorded within                  100 km of the source.  This data set is unique because the flow                 of technical information from that country is extremely slow due                to restrictions imposed on travel and field investigation in                    Iran.  The scientific community outside Iran is eager to learn                  about the behavior of the ground-motion generated in the near-                  source region and the lessons to be learned from this earthquake.               The attenuation of peak ground acceleration with distance and                   orientation will be analyzed and compared with other regions of                 the world.  This research is a component of the National                        Earthquake Hazard Reduction Program.
